inn1.comm: Dropped Oh dear! Ladies and gentleman, Graeme Swann has dropped Virender Sehwag. FIrst ball. It curved away from the off-stump line, Sehwag pushed away from the body, bat well stretched out and got a thick edge. Swann lunged to his right at second slip but the ball burst off the palms. Very tough chance. Collingwood might perhaps have taken it. Or Richie Richardson
gets forward, gets behind the line to defend

Almost another catch! What is happening out there? Anderson on fire. This one straightens on the leg and middle stump line, Sehwag thought it was going to drift down and shaped to flick it to square-leg. Shock. The ball straightens, flies off the leading edge and balloons over extra cover where Ian Bell dives back but it cleared him
Sharp lifter! Sehwag arches back, drops his wrists, gets the bat down as he sways away from the line of trouble
sprays this wide down the leg side. Crowd roar

Whoa! Hello Hello! Sehwag is flirting with danger here. Almost another catch. Again, the outswinger on the middle and leg line, again Sehwag thinks he can push it to the leg side. Mistake. The ball curves away, catches the leading edge and pops over a leaping Anderson. Phew. What a start
Tendulkar presents the full bat-face in defense here. The ball rolls back down the track.
Crowd roar! A full delivery well outside off stump, Sehwag doesn't quite move across, just leans his upper body across and drives through extra cover.
short in length, moves in towards off stump, Sehwag pushes it back to the bowler
in the zone outside off stump, the bowler thinks he has hit the zone, Sehwag, as ever, sees it as a width and throws his arms at it. The ball whooshes past the off stump
No violence this time. Pure timing, It was just outside off stump, back of length, Sehwag opened the bat-face and timed it through point.
moves his front foot forward and across, gets behind the line of the good-length delivery around off and pushes it to cover
Good delivery. It cut in towards the middle and leg line, cramped Sehwag, who tried to dab it to the on side but was struck high on the pad.
Crunchy! It was the short-of-length delivery just outside off, Tendulkar stood on his toes and punched it through extra cover. Like he has done all through his career.
gets forward, behind the line of the delivery coming in with the angle and defends to the off side
lovely delivery! It just about straightened outside off stump, Tendulkar almost stumbles out and pokes at it. The ball rushes past the edge. Anderson stares, Tendulkar taps the pitch
on the middle and off line, it looked to come in a bit but not as much as Tendulkar anticipated; he shaped to work it towards mid-on and the ball wobbled away to the off side
kicks up from short of length outside off, Tendulkar rides the bounce to push it to the off
stays at his crease, crouches a little, opens the bat-face and steers the ball out to point.
flickity flick! It was a good-length delivery on the middle and leg and Sehwag flicks it up and over midwicket. A fielder at deep, placed for the short ball, cuts it off
short in length, moves in towards middle and off, Tendulkar stays back, works his wrists and sends the ball to right of short midwicket who makes a tumbling save to his right
gets forward, rolls his wrist to get over the top of this cutter and taps it to short midwicket
the bouncer arrives, on the leg stump line and Tendulkar ducks.
Lands around off, kicks up towards the rib cage but Tendulkar side steps towards middle, and works the ball through backward square-leg region
slightly short in length outside off or so Tendulkar makes it appear as he gets back to punch it hard but straight to point
shortish delivery outside off, steered up and over, down to third man.. no slips in

stifled appeal for lbw as the bowler and keeper realize there was some inside edge on it. It was very full, Tendulkar was back, perhaps in anticipation of something shorter. He wafts at it and gets a thick inside edge
Curvaceous! Lovely stuff from Jimmy today. It landed on a good length just outside off and straightened. Tendulkar is beaten, pushing inside the line. No slip.
Almost caught at short midwicket! Tendulkar whipped a full delivery but it fell short of a diving short midwicket. Anderson holds his head.
Carved! It was a short of length just outside off, I repeat just outside off but Sehwag stayed comp[completely beside the line and carved it past backward point. Great skills.
again, he opens the bat-face, stays adjacent to the line and steers this one to third man
Full delivery on the middle and off, curving away a little, Sehwag fetches it from there and hits it uppishly to right of mid-on where Trott moves quickly to make a tumbling stop
Now Kevin Peitersen goes tumbling down the ground. Tendulkar had whipped this full delivery on the pads to deep backward square-leg region where Kevin makes an excellent diving stop
full in length again, Tendulkar gets forward to defend it to the off

High bouncer outside off and Tendulkar was caught in two minds: Whether to sway away or play the upper cut. He first started to sway away, saw the ball was rising slowly, held his balance and tried to upper cut it over vacant slips but no wood on leather
fullish delivery outside off, Tendulkar reaches across to slice it past backward point
full in length, moving in towards middle and off, like a typical Abdul Razzaq delivery, Tendulkar shapes to drive it straight but the ball rolls off the inner half of the bat to the on side

Whipped! It;s a short of length delivery on the middle, perhaps middle and leg, Sehwag stayed back and clipped it to deep square-leg region. Shehzad gets across in time but slips as his foot gets struck on the damp outfield and the ball rolls through his grasp.
pushes this to the off side
straying on the pads, flicked away to Shahzad for a single
full in length around off, Tendulkar taps it towards mid-on and calls for a single. Sehwag responds this time. Mike Atherton remembers the Dhaka run out on air.

Flat-batted whack! The slow pitch played its part in shot selection. It rose from short of length outside off, slower, and Sehwag waited. And waited. He then decided to shelve the cut shot and go for a forehand cross court. He whacked it up and over mid-on
fuller and it has been flicked away for a single
on a length around the off stump line, Sehwag gets forward and across to defend.
And again. Very compact. The front foot moved forward and across, towards the line of the ball and the head was over the ball as he defended. WAtch out for the next ball!
Bresnan pushes this to the pads, not a great choice, clipped through front of square., Kevin moves across to his left in the deep to mop it up
gets back and across, completely behind the line of the delivery this time and pushes it gently back down the track

Bresnan takes out Sehwag, with a little bit of help from Prior. It was a back of length delivery outside off, it came pretty slowly off the track, Sehwag thought ok then, I see some width, let me steer it through the vacant slips. Mistake. The ball wobbled off the face of the bat to right of Matt Prior who dived to take a good one-handed catch. Sehwag tucks the bat under his arm and walks off. The crowd... you know what they would have done, don't you...
lovely delivery first-up. Fine over too. This one angles away from Gautam Gambhir, who tries to play his favourite run down to third man but is beaten. There was a slip in place. Oohs and aahs.
full in length around the off stump, Tendulkar gets forward and defends. The full bat face and all that jazz
just outside off stump, Tendulkar pushes it to short extra cover
Whippy! Full and on the middle and leg and Tendulkar whipped it away through front of square.

This is even more skillfully played. It was on the middle and there was a backward square-leg in place. Tendulkar played it late, got his wrists working overtime and glided the ball to the right of that fielder.
leans across to punch this to the off side
in the zone outside off, Tendulkar gets forward and across, covers the off stump and shoulders arms. He then turns and watches the ball sail through to Prior
Meanwhile, this try running me down to third man game continues. Bresnan pings the off-stump channel and Gambhir has a poke. The ball rushes past the edge
he stands outside his crease, leans forward to tap this ball to midwicket
on the middle and leg, worked through backward square-leg region

kicks up outside off, from short of length, Tendulkar gets back, opens the bat-face and steers it to left of backward point. He took couple of steps down the track, stopped as he saw Gambhir looking doubtful about the single but they eventually get across in time
clipped away to long-leg where Shahzad fumbles to give an extra run. Atherton murmurs now, "This is the second time he has made a mistake on the field" Or words to that effect
short in length, angling away from Gautam who plays a weak cut shot to point
leans well forward to defend to the on side
slower, lovely delivery, floated outside off, Tendulkar had to wait on the front foot and deflected it to short midwicket
And again. Tendulkar times his forward move to the slower pace and works this ball through to deep midwicket
from round the stumps to the lefty, on the middle stump line, Gambhir was covering for the turn, there wasn't any and the ball rolls off the inner half of the bat to the leg side
skips down the track and drives this flighted delivery to sweeper cover
a tiny step forward, and then a bigger stretch forward and he tries to fetch this ball from outside off and work it to square-leg for a single. The ball turns past the waft and rolls off the pad
angling across Gautam who steers to point
The Sourav Ganguly shot! He rushes down the track, backs outside leg and cuts a short ball up and over backward point
slower, around the off stump, guided to point
slips this outside leg but Gambhir doesn't seize the opportunity. He clips it gently past square-leg for a single. There was a short fine-leg in. Had Gambhir been more alert and aware ...
banged in short of length, kicks up towards middle, defended back down the track. Tim is mixing things up nicely. At times, he hits the deck, at times he slows em up
outside off stump and Tendulkar plays the shot that the chairman of Indian selectors used to play a lot: Run down to third man
leans forward to ping long-on.
from round the stumps, nice off break on the off and middle line, Gambhir reaches out to square drive it through point
And another one down to long-on. After trying to work deliveries more square in the last over, it seems Tendulkar has decided to play Swann much straighter
Flamboyant! Gautam sashayed down the track and lofted it to long-on. Up up and over

Difficult chance  missed there was a thin inside edge.  Er, in that case, it was a missed catch and not a stumping chance! Swanny holds his head. Watch out for his tweet later. Gambhir moved down the track, got outside the leg stump and Swann drifted it just outside leg. Gambhir tried to lift it inside out over extra cover and got a thin inside edge and Prior couldn't adjust his hands in time.
leans forward to block this one
just outside off stump, tapped to point
short in length, just outside off, punched out to cover
gets forward to push to the off side
short in length outside off, cut away to backward point
Another dot ball as Tendulkar pushes it to the off side. Fine tight over so far. What would the final ball be? A bouncer?
Nope, he continues with what worked for him through the over. a Good-length delivery on the off stump line, Tendulkar steers to backward point
Fabulous inside-out hit over extra cover! Gautam gets outside leg even as he moves down the track, picks the flighted delivery drifting towards him and lifts it over the off-side field
leans forward to nudge this to the on side
couple of short steps down the track and works this off break from outside off, with the turn, to square-leg
fires this one quicker but in trying to do so, he pushes it down the leg side. Good take from the keeper
leans forward to dab this to the on side of the pitch
turns towards off stump, from round the stumps, defended to cover

on the middle stump line, moves in with the arm, Gambhir seemed to take a long time to decide what to do and the ball kept wobbling in towards middle stump. Towards his pad and towards the middle stump. Suddenly, Gambhir stirred and pushed the ball to cover point
short in length, outside off, cut away through point
extra bounce on this shortish delivery, steered to third man
rocks back to punch this back-of-length delivery to sweeper cover
lands on the leg stump, good length, moves towards middle, Gambhir clips it behind square-leg
banged in short outside off, Tendulkar thinks about the upper cut but doesn't carry through that thought.
Follows through with that thought this time. He reaches out to upper cut it over backward point
flighted up really slowly, it wobbled ever so gently across, almost ala a delivery from Ramesh Powar or like the man himself, Gambhir had to wait an eternity before he tapped it to point
pushes this down the leg side,. Prior tries a trick from gully cricket. He appeals for a catch. Nice try sir
keeps this one out to the off side
rocks back to cut through point for a single
Whackity whack! He rushed down the track and blasted this to the right of the bowler. Swann sort of held his right hand across to suggest he was going for the catch. That flew past him very quickly
gets forward to defend
turns in gently towards middle and off, Tendulkar backs away and tries a late cut but can't get power or placement.. the ball rolls to short third man
starts straight, on the mark, gentle offcut, no pace. Gambhir prods into the leg side
the line deviates down the leg side a fraction and that's all Gambhir needs to flick a single to fine leg
all of which means his plan of bowling straight continues, squeezed out to point

the ball was straight, but the bat much straighter. Tendulkar with one, simple movement has lifted this over the bowler's head and straight into the advertising boards. First six of the match, made to look indecently easy
ooh, screams of "catch it, catch it!" as this was guided one-bounce to short third man
fullish and straightish again from Collingwood, rather than belting it down the ground Tendulkar milks a single to pinch the strike
starts a touch slower than his normal darts, no spin of course and it's pushed to deep cover
just a touch too short and Gambhir is sitting back and uses the width outside off to punch to deep cover
classic Yardy! Low-arm, slung in, no spin, nothing for Tendulkar to work with
this time the line drifts a touch towards the pads and a flick of the wrists picks off a single
Gambhir walks down the crease and keeps walking through to complete a single after milking to long-on
Tendulkar this time on the walk, edging down and full-facing a middle-overs single to long-off. Decent start from Yardy, not sure Tendulkar would be overly worried though
good start to the new over, slowish around off stump and pushed back to the bowler
"excellent work Collywobble," says Prior. It was as Collingwood dived to field off his own bowling
ah, good battle here. Tendulkar edged down, Collingwood fired it wide of off and the batsman had to reach to poke it to point
another offcutter and it's worked carefully into the midwicket region
plenty of air on this, too much so, in fact, as it reaches Gambhir on the full. But the batsman only prodded it back down the pitch and Collingwood dived smartly to his left
decent over for England ends with Gambhir pushing a single into a gap at cover
Yardy over the wicket to the left-hander, angling onto the pads and the flick finds midwicket
this time Gambhir beats midwicket to amble through a single
touch of spin here! Actual spin! Tendulkar was as surprised as all of us and got a slight leading edge
down the track comes Tendulkar, Yardy sees him coming and digs it shorter, pushed past cover. Tendulkar wanted two, but Gambhir didn't
this time there is two, Gambhir playing late with an open face to fiddle this behind square on the off side
fired down the leg side, the sort of thing umpires don't like
scream from the batsman as he mistimes a leg-side nudge. Decent over, but not much more than that. Neither side is damaged but the India line-up is long
crowd erupts as Tendulkar edges down menacingly and smashes this, but straight to long-on
this is picked off into space
Tendulkar likes the look of Collingwood and brings his fifty up in style! Down the track, clears his front leg and eases his big bat through the line, sending it a long way over the midwicket rope
boundary followed up with an opened-face glide to third man. His strike rate is only going one way now
Gambhir does all he needs to, which is work a single off the pads. Strauss has called a bowling change by the looks of things, this innings is ticking now
ooh, poked towards short third man. Touch uppish and there was almost a mix-up with the running but after all that, no alarm. Apart from for the England players
Gambhir misses out here, short and wide but placed his cut shot straight to the man at point
gets another go at the shot and this time collects a couple out to deep cover
cripes, turn and bounce for Yardy. Look out England in the second half of this game! Bottom edged into the off side
single worked more solidly this time, using the spin on offer to nudge into the leg side
Tendulkar eases down the track and pushes this to long-off to jog a single
again it's pushed into space, these two looking very comfortable now
oops, not a great start to the new spell, shoved down the leg side
much better line here - off stump. The length is good too and catches Gambhir on the crease. The defence wasn't certain but no harm done
again Shahzad aims for the top of off, sound planning that, Gambhir plays very late as usual
ooh, looked like an inside edge here but the slower ball died on its way through to Prior. Gambhir trying to work a single with an angled bat
dug in a bit shorter this time, no great pace off the wicket but the line, into the body, is good enough to prevent Gambhir from doing anything but defend
decent over so far this, Gambhir tucks a single off his hip. No sign of reverse swing though
quiet over ends with Tendulkar picking out point with a cut shot
quickish ball from Yardy, not looking for that turn he's found, Gambhir flicks a single to deep midwicket
Tendulkar made his mind up to paddle a sweep very early, which means he goes down on one knee and back up again to play a shorter ball. Did it with ridiculous ease
this time a far more straightforward single is worked to leg with a flick of the wrists
dart, arrowed down short and it sits up but Gambhir content to push to deep cover
Yardy is being milked here, Tendulkar, you feel, could play this anywhere. As it is, he turns it around the corner for one
and Gambhir joins the middle-over fun by jogging a single pushed to long-off
full, straight, attacking the stumps. Gambhir shapes for the straight drive but taps it straight back
slapped down to third man, that's an easy one
short and rising outside off, down to third man. Is he trying to reverse it?
fuller again - that's the length to be bowling on this placid pitch. An wailing, emotive appeal as it strikes the pad but that's very optimistic indeed
Sachin makes this shot look regulation, but it'd be a cracker off the bat of any other batsman - on the up and drilled to cover point. Fielder's there to stop it though
deft touch! Length again, this time he waits until the very last instant and opens the face, sending it down to third man. Not quite fine enough to find the rope
That. Is. Enormous. Karthik, you called it, Sachin goes after Swann's very first ball, over wide long-on with immense power
and again! Slog sweep this time, but it's equally big, the ball landing deep in the crowd at midwicket. This stadium is absolutely heaving with noise now
it won't be three in three, but it's good batting all the same. After the violence, Sachin just tucks this round the corner for a quick single
held back a touch, Gambhir isn't quite to the pitch and taps gently to cover
past the edge! Again Swann takes pace off the ball, getting it to grip just a touch and spin past the outside edge of a slightly lazy push
on the pads, and he's milked through square leg
dug in pretty short, Tendulkar buckles his knees to get underneath it and briefly thinks about the upper-cut
back-of-a-length, Tendulkar is up on his toes and forcing into the covers
placement! Third man was very fine - perhaps moving there after Tendulkar's late cut in the last over - and as Shahzad digs another one in he's cut up and over gully and square of third man
too straight, Tendulkar threads the gap at midwicket for a couple
slapped very hard indeed, but Collingwood is at backward point and tumbles to his right to cut it off

and past the edge to finish the over! Did this hit the seam, or was it the leg cutter? Either way, it's bounced a bit more than expected and also moved away from the bat. Nothing going for England though!
very full on off stump to start, dug out to mid-off
sumptuous driving from Tendulkar, on the up and through the covers! Technically just about as perfect as you can get, and it even gets past KP's dive on the ropes
and again, this time Anderson offers up a gift wide of off stump and is duly thrashed square of the wicket
that's the length and the line he should be bowling, Anderson goes fuller and much straighter and this time it's just the one run
another boundary, but this time it's a lucky one! Full again, Gambhir launches into a drive and a thick inside edge flies down to fine leg past the stumps. That's his fifty too, good work

past the edge! The last couple of overs have all ended this way ... Anderson nibbles one away from the left-hander, who is flat-footed in the drive and easily beaten. The ball dies off the wicket though, dipping on Prior
Swann comes round the wicket, and it's a low full toss but Tendulkar can't get it away as he whips to leg
flicked very fine towards fine leg this time, but the man at 45 scoots across very quickly to cut it off
full again, Swann sticking with the defensive round-the-wicket line and he's nudged down the ground for one

gone! Against the run of play Swann has got the breakthrough. It was a good ball, biting into the pitch and spinning past what was another very lazy nurdle from Gambhir. It looked like he was trying to get it down to third man, but the feet went nowhere. Poor shot, and it's got England back into the game
good start to Yuvraj, held back again but the batsman is right behind it in defence
driven down the ground, Swann dives but it's in vain and Yuvraj is off the mark
tucked off the legs and down to fine leg, the crowd awaken as it was hit pretty well but there's a fielder down there to cut it off
Anderson pulls the length back but this wicket is slowing up considerably and Tendulkar's got plenty of time to run it down to third man. It helps that he's seeing it like a football
again off the hip, and worked down on the leg side
is there a pattern forming here? Back of a length, down to third man. Well, I suppose he's only giving away singles so that's something

that has pinged out of the middle of the bat! Anderson was trying to mix things up, perhaps aiming for the yorker, but it's slipped out as a low full toss and Yuvraj brings the bat down quickly to send the ball racing to wide long-on
chopped into the covers, and an easy single to end the over
looped up on middle, played to mid-on
good stuff from Swann, again good lines from him and Yuvraj is tucked up as the ball grips on the surface
Yuvraj wants a single from somewhere, he drops this towards cover but there's a man prowling there
appeal from Swann as ball strikes pad, but that didn't straighten nearly enough, slipping down leg. The appeal was short-lived
flighted outside off, Yuvraj stretches forward into a drive but picks the man at extra cover once again
flicked to short fine leg this time, and though there aren't that many men populating the inner ring - I can count three or maybe four - he can't find the gap just yet. A maiden

speared in first ball, but that's angling down the leg side and Tendulkar just needs to lay bat on it to get in down to the fine leg boundary. He's 94 now, one hit away from a second ODI ton against England
again Yardy is just a touch too straight, nudged into the gap square on the leg side for one
quick, slightly short of length but crunched straight back to the bowler
gripping and spinning a touch into the pads, off the inner half of the bat and the ball rolls into the leg side. Tendulkar calls for one
again held back by Yardy, a hint of turn and Tendulkar plays it with due caution
slightly off line and Tendulkar pats him into the covers for one - he's got 96 now and he's also got the strike for the next over
Swann's round the wicket, quick and on the pads. Tendulkar can't get it away, and is struck on the pad. The appeal dies in Swann's throat as he realises its pitched outside leg
Tendulkar steps forward, working across the front pad for an easy single
on Yuvraj's pads this time, and it's clipped to leg
looking for the dab down to third man, but the fielder is round in a flash to cut it off
fuller, pushed back to the bowler
again the single comes from the last ball of the over, landing on a leg stump line and the ball is nudged through midwicket

there it is! On the hips, the Little Master gets across and whips it down to the fine leg boundary. The crowd cheer as one! That's his fifth World Cup hundred, his second against England. What a knock it's been, superbly paced
chopped slightly awkwardly into the off side, there's no run there
pushed into the off side, this time he finds the gap and that's a single
dug in very short, Yuvraj ducks well underneath it and immediately looks to the square leg umpire, but that's not a wide
the half pull/half flick off the pads down to fine leg
fuller, pushed into the leg side but the man runs round to mid-on to stop the single
low full-toss, Yuvraj plays the wristiest of whips to pick the ball up and over a leaping Collingwood at midwicket. Four runs, and will that be the shot to open his innings up?
better from Swann, actually hitting the pitch this time and Yuvraj can't get it away
full again, Yuvraj lunges well down the wicket and drives down to long-off
Tendulkar's fifth six! He clears the left leg and murders this over long-on. Flat and hard!
again he looks for the big shot, coming down the wicket. The ball comes off the toe end though, looping over Swann and down to long-off
this one rushes on with the arm, taking the inside edge of the bat. Hands on heads for both keeper and bowler
crack! Short from Bresnan, Yuvraj rocks back and thrashes a pull to square leg. That's just the start India wanted
short again, and spicy! This is much better directed than the last, Yuvraj whips his head out of the way at the very last moment and looks a little rattled too. One for the over, says the umpire
slower ball, fuller too. Yuvraj sets himself to have an enormous swipe, but perhaps just tries to over-hit it. Off the pad and a leg-bye taken
length on off stump, Tendulkar leans forward and drives to cover
wrong line, and that's four! Back of a length and Tendulkar swivels into a powerful pull, getting the ball past the man at short fine. Square leg had no chance either, well struck
Bresnan aims this one very full, but he can't stop the single as it's tapped out into the leg side. At least it's only a single!
hurled down very quick from round the wicket, practically medium pace. Nudged towards third man for a quick single
fast again, and aimed right at the off stump. Yuvraj makes a bit of room and chops down on the ball, but can't beat backward point
this time he aims to leg, but straight to midwicket. Along the ground
fuller, straighter. Yuvraj leans forward and works round the front pad through square leg, this time he does get the one
Tendulkar looks for the lofted paddle over the man at short fine leg, but a quick ball zips past the bat, hitting the pad. Definitely going down leg, not even the hint of an appeal, leg bye taken
this has been a great Powerplay over from Yardy, again he's speared it in and this time he gets the ball to hold its line outside off, beating the outside edge of Yuvraj's bat
four runs! Anderson goes full and straight but Sachin steps across to off and whips it with great purpose past the man at short fine leg. How do you stop that? It was the right ball for the field

Tendulkar falls! He was looking to the leg side once again, but went a touch too early at the ball and a leading edge loops gently to cover. Anderson strikes, no doubt with great relief! What an innings that was for Tendulkar, he's set his team up for a massive total
ooh, almost a double for Anderson! Yuvraj tries to turn into the leg side, leading edge loops agonisingly short of Anderson
banged in short again, doesn't look all that comfortable but still manages to whip a pull shot to fine leg
banged in short again from Anderson, doesn't dare go full. Dhoni drags a single to deep square
ah, the length wasn't wrong but if you ball short, don't bowl down the leg side, Yuvraj just needed to help it on its way and it raced to the ropes
Yardy is spearing it in, but too short and sits up asking for trouble. Dhoni flashes his hands through it and it's raced to point boundary
ooh, much, much quicker and the angle was perfect, heading to leg stump. Dhoni got into a tangle and missed it
little bit short again and Yardy is lucky to get away with this as Dhoni bangs it to point fielder
again Dhoni has picked out the infielder. Small mercy for England
very quick again from the bowler, no room to work with either and Dhoni just about manages to push down the ground
but for one delivery that was an excellent Yardy over. Takes serious courage to bowl spin to these batsmen in the Powerplay and he's done it well so far
shoved in short as usual, good delivery because the line is right and Dhoni bobbles a single off a flurry of bat and arm
slower bouncer, it was very slow indeed and Yuvraj almost ducked into it. Loped over him very gently
another slow bouncer and Yuvraj could have played three shots before it reached him, as it was he was through a pull too early and top-edged down to fine leg
no pace on the ball and Dhoni is flashing his arms at it to try and generate some, only earns a single though
England sitting back and content to allow singles, which you can hardly blame them for after all the carnage we've seen
short again, slower again, and it's worked well again. Dhoni desperately trying to hold back on his pull shot before  mistiming to mid-on
cripes, this is very wide, arrowed down leg and Prior makes a tough take look routine
again Yardy has abandoned spin and flight for flat darts, working well too as Yuvraj dinks a single to midwicket
again Yardy hurls it down very straight and Dhoni can only pick off a single around the corner
Yuvraj stands tall to bunt this low-arm sling to long-on
bottom-handed whip from Dhoni, just for a single though. No air on the ball, plenty of pace though
excellent running from Dhoni earns two, Yuvraj pushing wide of long-on and his partner urging him to wheeze a second
ah, slight misfield from Swann at short third man ruins a good over. Yuvraj using the pace on the ball to glide it off the bat, beats Swann and it skims along to the boundary
good start from Shahzad, back of a length. Dhoni, with his new bat seems to force with the bottom hand through cover, which only he could do really
goodness, this was less short than it was very, very wide down the leg side. Lucky Yuvraj missed it really

we all know it's going to be short and Yuvraj certainly does too. He sits back waiting for it and a waist-high bouncer was never going to end prettily for the bowler. Thwacked straight of the square leg for four
shortish again but this time it's pushed to cover
short to Dhoni this time, he was waiting for it too and after mistiming a couple he's nailed this. Almost hacking himself off his feet as he swung this to the rope
England bleeding again. Too short, too wide and Dhoni smashes his arms and wrists through the line, pinging it to the cover boundary
light relief for England as Dhoni pushes down the ground for an easy single that Yuvraj, for no good reason, rejects
Yardy's low-slung darts continue to do a decent job, Yuvraj whipping a single around the corner
"yes Mickey!" shouts  a relieved Prior as Dhoni mistimes it back to the bowler
again there is no room, no air and no spin, Dhoni tries to force it past the bowler but can't beat him
cut away, but only for a single. What a good job Yardy is doing here
the crowd are getting louder as Yuvraj stands tall and punches a single down the ground
excellent over ends with Dhoni collecting a single down the ground. Huge relief for Strauss to have some respite at one end
much better, full and straight and singles are a relief for England as Dhoni squeezes this out to long-off
ah, don't bowl short, don't bowl full. Maybe just don't bowl at all. Yuvraj sees one in his range, leans back and smashes this half-volley to the midwicket boundary
shorter this time, slower too, and it works as Yuvraj misses out on a leg-side hoik
that's better, no room for Dhoni to work with and he forces a drive to cover, who is hanging back on the ring, understandably
fifty for Yuvraj! Finding his touch now. Comes down the wicket a touch before flicking a full ball very delicately, beating short fine leg to collect his eighth boundary
swing and a miss! Shortish and Yuvraj tried to pull into the leg side, didn't get near it. Prior was interested but nobody else was
ooh, look out Billy Bowden! Dhoni absolutely mullered this back down the pitch, Yardy shoved a hand out to get something on it and Billy dived out the way just in time
tuned around the corner, just a single but these two look like they're ready to go
wow, that has gone a long, long way. It's 12. Touch short and Dhoni rocked back to hack this into the stands at midwicket. Stadium heaving now, England tottering
again he thwacks hard against the line, just a single though
ah now Yuvraj on the case. Down on one knee and sweeping majestically, pinging it to the midwicket rope

and gone. Stadium goes quiet for a moment, just a moment. Short and Yuvraj just got it off the bottom of the bat out to deep midwicket where Bell held a simple catch. No great celebration from England, hardly surprising really. Good work from Yuvraj and crucially for India as the tournament goes on, he's found his form
Dhoni falls now! Two in two for England. Shortish ball that Dhoni swung hard at but straight to Luke Wright at deep midwicket.
Yusuf away straight away, working a single into space
stylish flick of the wrists sends this down to deep square

ooh, almost another for England. Short again, Pathan hacking in Wright's direction just like his captain did. This time though Wright didn't quite pick it up and dived in too late, reached him on the bounce and burst through to the ropes
horrible hack at this, never looked like timing it and didn't. Single down the ground will do though
falls short again! This time Ian Bell running in from deep midwicket as Kohli slapped it out in his direction without all that much timing
slower ball, well disguised and Pathan was half-way through his shot before the ball had arrived. In the end he adjusted well to drag it round to midwicket
yorker, and it's a good one. Nowhere for Kohli to go but jab a single
full slower ball this time, Pathan swung himself off his feet again but was through the shot too quickly
gets this one though! Pathan hanging back, and turns a yorker into a half-volley before smashing the life out of it, down the ground and over the rope
just a single this time, much to Anderson's relief as the hack is mistimed

oh dear, England already have too much to chase so this won't help. Swann as made a hash of a very simple stop at short fine leg and allowed it to run through for four. This is India's highest score in ODIs in Bangalore now
Swann gets this one right, Pathan again swinging wildly but the slower ball meant he mistimed it and it looped out to mid-off
and another! Bresnan getting good reward for being England's best bowler. Yorker length, Kohli gives himself room, too much room in fact and it thuds into the base of off stump. Here comes Zaheer
ooh, almost a team hat-trick as Collingwood misses a run out chance from point

Three in four for Bresnan to give him his 5th wicket! Full, swinging in late and striking Harbhajan on the back boot right in front of the stumps. Harbhajan reviewed but it was still very out. That's also Bresnan's career-best ODI figures. England finishing well, just the first 46 overs that cost them
gets a length ball first up that is pushed out to cover
flash and miss outside off stump to finish an excellent spell from Bresnan. With carnage happening all around him, he's held his nerve, length and line and finished with 5 for 48. Mighty fine effort
length ball around off stump, Chawla just about manages to drag it down to long-on
Anderson indeed doesn't, slower ball too and some smart running means Zaheer gets a couple. Also makes this the most expensive England figures in World Cup history
just a single this time bunted down the ground
oh dear oh dear. This has gone all wrong. No ball, wide outside off. Reached Prior on the bounce, burst through and ran away for four.
free hit ends underwhelmingly as Chawla bunts straight back to Anderson, sets off for a run that would never happen and Anderson takes the bails off

India innings ends with a whimper, but there was plenty of bang for most of it.  England ended up bowling India out as Zaheer tries to steal a second after pulling the ball to midwicket. And Munaf Patel has not placed the bat inside the crease during the first run. One short. And hence no runs this ball

inn2.comm: Two slips in. Full delivery on the pads and Strauss starts off with a nice flick shot.
full again, looking for swing, there is none, Strauss on drives to mid-on
And so draws back the length to a good length and gets it to seam away a bit outside off, left alone
full in length, around the off stump line, driven to cover
ooh a gem: It landed on a good length around off and held its line. Strauss stabbed at thin air. Dhoni collects
Fine response from the English skipper. It was a back of a length delivery and there was some width on it, Strauss loves these square shots and he punches this one through point

what a start from Munaf. a loud shout for a catch behind. Or was it for the lbw? It landed on a good length around off stump and cut away, a leg cutter, moved past the defensive poke and hit the back thigh, outside the off stump, and went to Dhoni.
Same story as last over. A four after being beaten. KP leaned forward and clipped a length delivery off his pads to the backward square-leg boundary. nicely done
Munaf pushes this one as well outside leg. KP, already standing outside the crease, took a big stride forward and across
Munaf returns to what he did in the first ball: He gets this to burst through from a good length in the zone outside off and KP is beaten, pushing inside the line
gets forward to drive the full-length to the left of Munaf, who deflects it wide of mid-off
Lovely timing. Similar to the four he hit off Zaheer. He glided back and punched it sweetly through point.
full in length, just outside off, run down to third man
in the channel outside off stump and it curved away, left alone
around the off stump line, Strauss tries to work it to the on side and mistimes it ..
A slower one, full in length just outside off and Strauss pushed at it and the ball ran off the edge but fell well short of Sehwag, the lone slip fielder
shorter in length, on the middle and that length allows Strauss to whip it through midwicket
on the pads, clipped to backward square-leg where Piyush makes a diving half-stop. the ball rolls away from him and by the time he recovers, they come back for the second

rushes down the track for the big drive through off but Zaheer dragged back the length and got it to move past the bat. Dhoni collects. Tv comms reckon there was a noise and an edge there. Dhoni thought about appealing but wasn't sure. No snicko or hot spot of course
moves in to roll off the pad
tries to go down the track again but edges the intended big hit to the leg side
around the off stump line, dabbed to backward point

He was batting so well with the conventional methods. Suddenly he is trying to rush down the track and slog and its not working. He again moved down the pitch and tried to heave to the leg side but edges it to his body
around the off stump, from a good length, pushed out to mid-off
Yet another big hit attempted but mistimes the pull shot and ends up dragging it to square-leg
around the off stump line, defended back to Zaheer. Another one on the good length
gets forward to push the good-length delivery past the bowler for a single
shorter in length, around the off stump, mistimes yet another pull but will get a single through to Tendulkar at deep midwicket
just outside off stump, was it slightly slow? perhaps it kept a touch lower than what KP thought... and he ended up edging and jabbing it to the off
kicks up from a good length and angles away from KP who goes hard at it, trying to pierce the off-side field but gets no wood on leather.
tries to walk down the track but Munaf hits the back of length and keeps it around off, and strauss defends
drops this fractionally shorter than normal and Strauss, a good puller, drags it to deep midwicket fielder
full in length, on the middle line, deflected to midwicket

Harbhajan misses a catch Strauss tried to heave this and went aerial to the left of mid-on where Harbhajan moved and for some reason went with one hand. It wasn't too far away from him and he went pretty awkward at it. He then suggests he should have gone with both hands
gets forward to work this around for a single
moves well forward, pushes this towards mid-on and calls for a quick single. There is a direct hit - an under-arm flick but KP was home
pushes this towards Harbhajan at mid-off for a single. The ball rolled slowly off the bat and he had enough time to complete the single
good probing delivery, cutting in from around the off stump from a good length and the ball goes of the edge to the body. The ball rolls to the off and KP calls for a quick single
Classy! It was a good-length delivery around off stump and KP took a step forward and punched it on the up and between Struass and the umpire. Neatly timed.
and follows it up with a messy effort. He went down the track, got outside leg and went hard, too hard perhaps, at a back-of-length delivery and the ball rolls out to cover
And returns to his imperious best again. Much fun. Full in length, around the off stump and KP drives it gloriously to the left of Zaheer.
tries a slower one but slips down the leg side
another slower one, full and on the pads, Kevin Pietersen flicks it away to deep square-leg region. They are on the bike here.
a leg gully was in and the ball was on the pads but Strauss clips it straight to that fielder.He looks across at KP and smiles
gets back to cut this to Yuvraj at backward point. Yuvraj gets the crowd going with a shy at the non-strikers' end
pushes this to cover and there is confusion over the single. KP is late to respond but eventually scampers across . Kohli's throw misses the stumps and KP might have just got in time
takes couple of steps down the track, the ball kicks up from short of length and KP takes the bottom-hand off the handle as he works the ball to midwicket
in the zone outside off stump, Strauss waits before punching it to right of backward point where Yuvraj stops
in the channel again, Full in length, Struass tries to run it down to third man and is beaten. Gambhir must have appreciated the effort
Whack! He walked couple of steps down the track, Zaheer bangs it in short around off and KP cuts up and over backward point
slower cutter, on the middle, pushes it back to the bowler
England keep turning it on in style. He skipped down the track, moved towards off and unfurled a leg glance to a length delivery on the middle and off stump line, past short fine-leg .
pushes this to Piyush at mid-on for a single
full in length just outside off, driven to right of mid-off for a single
slower cutter around off stump, Kevin picks this and eases it gently to left of long-off for couple of runs
it landed short of length around leg and middle and moved past the prod to hit the back thigh and it rolled away through the vacant slips to the third man boundary
taps this past backward point for a single

Hello Hello! This is a Youtube moment from Munaf. KP had smashed a full delivery back to Munaf, who put his hands out, to catch and more to save his face i reckon, even as he slipped to the ground. The ball popped up of his palm and gravity took it right back to Munaf, now sitting on the ground, who puts his left hand up and pouches it very calmly. KP can't believe it. The crowd love it. And for some reason, Munaf even throws in an appeal!
good crispy extra cover drive from Trott who leaned into this full delivery
full delivery on the pads, flicked away for couple of runs
drags this short and on the pads, Strauss pulls it past the leg gully fielder. Munaf mutters and cusses as he walks away
gets back to flick this past square-leg
presses back to clip it to square-leg
leg break from the middle stump line, whipped to deep midwicket fielder
almost a long hop but Strauss drags it to deep square-leg fielder. Strauss gently bangs his helmet with his bat!
fuller and turning away from the off and middle line, pushed out to extra cover
Another long hop and again, Strauss fails to make full use of it. He pulls it to Yuvraj at deep midwicket
a slip in place and he is bowling from round the stumps. Strauss lets this one turn away to Dhoni
flighted just outside off, cut to point
picks it from middle stump and sweeps to Gambhir at long-leg for  a single. 4000 ODI runs for Andrew S. It;s flashed at big screen and the crowd give him a pretty generous applause
slip and leg slip in place and Trott eases this flighted delivery to long-on
quicker one, skidding towards off and middle, full in length but Strauss was on the back foot and got his bat down in a hurry to push it to cover
unfurls another sweep to retain the strike
flighted full on a length on the middle, turned wide of short fine-leg for a single
around the off stump, holds its line, Trott leans forward to defend
fuller, on the middle and off, slider, Trott is late to pick it up but eventually moves across in time to push it to the off
teases him with a delivery on a good length outside off, Trott eases it to long-off
The googly arrives: Strauss goes down the track and is beaten by the googly,. he tries to whip it to the on side and edges it past the slip fielder. It runs down to third man boundary.
gets forward to push this to right of mid-off for a single
from round the stumps, one slip in , turns away from the off stump, Strauss guides it to right of backward point
tossed up outside off, tapped to point
Neat! He fetched the full delivery from outside off and dragged it intentionally well to the right of long-on.
full and around off, eased to long-on this time

flighted just outside off stump, STrauss pushes it to cover for a single. fifty up for him His team-mates and the crowd applaud. Good knock so far. He went too hard couple of times, tried to slog, but settled down quickly.
works this past square-leg for a single
flighted around off stump line and Trott off drives it to long-off
on the pads, rolls away to leg slip

Tendulkar makes a mess at fine-leg. It was swept to left of him, he had reached well in time but went down so slowly with his left hand and just didn't stop it at all. Poor effort says Atherton, "must be tired after his batting effort," says Sunny! Ooh la la!
what a ripper of a googly. Andrew doesn't pick it up. It breaks away past his poke, hits the back pad and DHoni takes it
works this away for a single
leans across to defend
flighted outside off stump, skids on almost straight with the arm, Strauss edges the off drive to square-leg
works this off break through to deep midwicket
on the leg stump, turns in, Strauss tries to work it to square-leg, misses and is hit on the pad
on the pads again, clipped to deep midwicket
the top spinner outside off, Trott stayed back, perhaps picked it off the pitch (my guess from the way he stabbed at it) and pushed it back to the bowler
turns in, worked to midwicket
Chawla throws this up and Strauss leans it to midwicket
more air again but this time Strauss comes down on a sweep, real executioner move and it speeds out to deep square
ooh, neither batsman picking Chawla here. This googly has Trott hurrying a bat down in a panic
Chawla strikes! It was so plump Trott pretty much walked. Went back to play across the line, should have been forward, missed it and India have their second
ooh, googly again! Bell didn't read it and was struck on the pad. Spinning too much I guess
and here's the leggie! What a ripper, spinning past the outside edge. Dhoni screams the bails off. England in a pickle now. Did I say Harbhajan was the man?
Strauss deep into his crease and very careful in defence
little bit short and a little bit wide, gives Strauss the room to unfurl his favourite cut shot
Bell is away, pushing down the ground simply enough
ah, how has that ended up at the extra cover rope? Looked like Strauss got a leading edge but it raced to the boundary
slightly flatter this time from the bowler, Strauss back on the cut, but there is no room for him
quicker and flatter from Harbhajan, spearing it in and Strauss jabs down on it
another googly, too short though and Strauss was sitting back waiting for it, pulled hard but straight to the boundary rider on the leg side
very full face of the bat sends this down to long-off. Bell is a good player of spin
this is very short indeed and Strauss needs to do more with it. Slugged hard off the back foot but straight to deep square
very early Bell decided to pop down on one knee and dink this over his head. A swifter fielding side would have kept this to one
short again, as he has been all over really. Bell gets into a good position to pull but can't get any power on the stroke
poor ball, short and well down the leg side, Strauss didn't have much to do but made sure he took full toll, lapping fine of the leg slip to collect four more
neatly played this, a simple milk. Bell stretching over to the off side and pushing with the spin down to long-on
ooh, too close for the shot! Strauss trying to cut but there is no room for it
first up Strauss wants to sweep, then it's too short for it so stands up to cut, but the initial move meant the cut was bottom edged and it dribbled away
this time the single is taken, with the aid of a misfield
Strauss is desperate to cut but the ball is just not there for it and he can't time it
Harbhajan was very interested! Long appeal. Nobody else was though, as Strauss missed an attempted sweep and was struck, outside off, on the back pad
starts well enough with Strauss edging down the wicket to prod into the leg side
finally Strauss makes the most of a short ball. Fetching from off stump and slugging to the midwicket rope
touch of air on this and Strauss just has to check a drive back to the bowler
oh dear, nothing shot. Flat-footed poke outside off and luckily for the batsman, he missed it
swept uppishly, with plenty of top edge, one-bounce out to fine leg
no such alarm from Bell, helping the ball into the leg side to pinch the strike
ooh, soft hands and outside edge contrive to make this go to slip on the bounce
more intent from Bell here, down the wicket and flicking powerfully to deep midwicket
Strauss hanging on the crease and playing this very late defensively
bit of a rumpus here as Strauss prods this back to the bowler, Harbhajan has to run around Bell to field, misses an easy stop to give a single, and has a moan at Bell for it
Bell is unperturbed by it all and works this with the spin around the corner. England content to sit back against Harbhajan
touch short from Harbhajan allows Strauss, who is on the back foot anyway, to cut out to deep cover
good start to the new over, flattish and straight and nothing Strauss can do
this is dragged down enough for Strauss to cut, should probably have got more of it
Bell offers a picture-perfect forward block, utmost respect for Yuvraj
Bell is on one knee here, not out of more respect, instead to dink a sweep to fine leg
wow, Strauss really hit this very hard indeed. Fetched from outside off stump around the corner with a stinging sweep shot
a man in form knows how to keep the strike and Strauss is in form. Pushed down to long-on
slides on with the arm, no spin for Strauss to work with and he's cramped for room on a cut shot
ah Strauss! Who said he's not versatile enough for Asia? Reverse sweeping with indecent ease and sending it rushing to the third man rope
having taken the boundary he can push a single into space. Crowd rather quiet at the moment
Bell this time edges down the pitch and strokes out to long-on
hint of spin almost causes alarm but Strauss is careful in defence
nothing risky here just a full-faced bunt, down the ground to take the strike again
with the field set very deep singles are available all around and Strauss gets deep into his crease to punch one down to long-on
Bell tries to match Strauss but mistimes his drive
ooh, Bell down the wicket and aiming an inside-out drive, skews off the edge and loops down one-bounce short of deep cover
Strauss on his favourite cut shot, didn't get all that much of it but scampered a single to third man
fine work from Bell, edged forward, Yuvraj dragged down in response and he rocked back to back cut to the deep point boundary behind square. Lovely shot

Bell goes down very early to try and paddle one of those dinked sweep shots, ends up missing and is struck on the pads. Looks gone but Bowden gives it not out. India called for a review. Looks like it's given, all the replays showed it hitting and Bell is walking but NO!? Decision stays not out! Bell, apparently, was so far down the track that it remains up to the umpire
middle and leg, nudged into the leg side
turned against the spin for a single into the leg side
quicker ball pushed back to the bowler
flicked backwards of square for a couple
pushed gently back to the bowler
clipped around to fine leg, simple work for Bell
well, Bell is happy to keep on paddling, again down early to clip around the corner
Strauss gets deep into his crease, working with the spin out to deep midwicket
Bell is a lovely driver of the ball but at the moment is all sweeps, reverse this time. Again doesn't get much of it but tickles a single
Strauss, meanwhile, looks in good order and drives a single hard down the ground
why sweep when you can do this? Couple of steps down the track and full-facing a riskless single to long-off
Strauss tries to be too cute here, gliding to third man, gets an inside edge
flicked down to deep square, England collecting singles at will here
the runs keep flowing and that takes Strauss to 99! Just using the pace on the ball to tickle it fine around the corner and Sehwag can't reach it
ooh, Strauss plays and past his outside edge
again this is carefully blocked. Waiting on 99....

that is a sparkling hundred from the England captain! Under huge pressure he's silenced this crowd and put England in with a chance of pulling off something incredible. Gets there by driving firmly out to dee cover to bring up his 100 from 99 balls. Punches the air but is quickly back with game-face on. Plenty more to come he hopes...
Bell doing his bit now! India rocking and the crowd is stunned. Nothing more than a flick of the wrists and it flies straight of midwicket to the boundary
flat and quick and nudged back to the bowler
oh don't bowl short to Strauss, he loves a cut shot and gets all of this. Screams past cover for four
short again, runs again! Cut hard out to deep cover
this is fuller and Strauss is hanging deep in his crease to push back to the bowler
seems like there are spaces everywhere here, Strauss collects an easy couple by nudging into a vacant midwicket area
full this time and Strauss is frustrated with himself for picking out the midwicket fielder up in the ring
oooh, almost works the trick. Bell down the track and aiming a loose drive. Some away reverse swing beats the edge and Zaheer has a long, long stare at Bell
Bell driving loosely again, gets some bat on this though. Cover collects and the crowd think they have a wicket, first we've heard from them in about 10 overs
good work from Zaheer, three dots now as he hangs the ball around off stump. Bell picking out cover again
after three tries Bell manages to time his cover drive. All of which earns just a single as the man on the boundary collects
Strauss stands tall and punches to long-on. No swing on show there

just when the over looked like a good one England get a slice of luck. Zaheer finds the edge, which squirts down to the third man rope. India's fielders look disgusted, the crowd sound aghast and the England batsmen punch gloves. Game on!
Strauss flows a drive down to long-off. Touch of air from Yuvraj there
Bell picks off a single this time, waiting on the back foot to thread this past point
Strauss confident on the sweep here, coming down hard on the ball and nailing it down to fine leg
Bell absolutely creamed it to cover, who fielded smartly
leading edge this time! Bell down the wicket and lazily turning his wrists against the spin, almost caused him all kinds of bother
England 200 up with Bell chipping down to long-off
glided down to third man

do you remember at the beginning of the innings, when there might have been an edge off Strauss's bat but no-one appealed? Well, looks like it's happened again. Strauss is beaten by one that nips off the seam, and there's a suspiciously woody sound as ball passes bat ...
nudged away for a single, and that's another to his total
driven on the up, and up-and-over cover! Extra cover leapt but couldn't get close, and he's found the gap
dropped close in, towards backward point. The fielder, Kohli I think it is, was right on the edge of the circle so there's an easy single there - when there shouldn't have been one
full on off stump, Strauss steps forward and drives hard but straight at mid-off. This time there's no run, Harbhajan charging in quickly to attack the ball
paddle-swept down on the leg side, but fine leg is out so there's defence there and it's just the one
Strauss brings up the hundred partnership in superb style! Stepping down the track, he gets right to the pitch and lifts the ball miles over wide long-on, 94 metres
and Yuvraj responds by zipping one on with the arm and past the outside edge
beaten once again, this time on the cut, as Yuvraj finds a touch of extra bounce
whipped off the pads and out to square leg for a single
punted down the ground, long-off runs in as they take a single
a touch too short, Bell steps back and chops to cover point for one
again the ball isn't close enough to the batsman, the ball spins into the pads as Strauss rocks back and tucks to leg
fiercely struck by Bell, who's back and pulling, but Yuvraj dives to his left to cut it off and flings the ball at the non-striker's end ... but the throw goes wide and Strauss is home
six runs! Bell goes to fifty now, from 45 balls, with a powerful strike over long-on. Hasn't he settled well since that nervous start against Chawla?
nudged to leg, quick single taken
now he's picking the wrong 'un! Strauss rocks back and cuts, the ball flying in the air but right into the gap and away to the boundary. England are looking good here, India need some inspiration
loosener, back of a length outside off. Bell rides the bounce and gets the ball down to third man
short, pulled, four. The last couple of overs, the story's been the same - a boundary and the pressure comes off
on the leg stump and rising a touch off a length, Strauss steps across to off stump and glances off the hip
good line from Munaf, in the channel on off stump. Bell defends to cover and lets out a loud "no!"

was that the slower one? The cutter? Or did it just plug in the surface? Whatever the reason, Bell played too early at it, the ball flying in the air through cover point as the bottom hand comes off the handle. No catcher there though
full of length, seaming away from the left-hander and driven hard out to the cover sweeper
spin and bounce outside off, Strauss cuts and the ball flies at a catchable height ... but right into the gap! Down to third man and four, point had no chance
fuller and driven this time, again in the air but with this defensive field there are gaps all over the place. Out to the cover sweeper
Harbhajan comes round the wicket, landing it on leg stump, and Bell eases him down to long-on for one
Strauss has another attempt at the reverse sweep, this time it doesn't come off but it's still a single as the ball trickles into the covers
Bell stays deep in the crease and nudges off the pad for a quick single
and now Strauss drives down to long-on. Everything going England's way, 9 runs off the over
Strauss eyes the leg-side boundary with a huge swipe off the back foot ... but the ball nips between body and bat and through to the keeper
Strauss takes the safe route this time, tapping another back-of-a-length delivery down to third man

more length from Munaf, it's nice and straight and there's not a whole lot Bell can do with that, pushing it back towards the bowler. The crowd cheer the dot ball, and the fielding effort from the bowler
too short, too wide, and cracked out to deep cover. "Two!" is the immediate call from Bell, and two it is
short again, but straighter this time. Bell rocks back to pull but doesn't find himself in the greatest position - the ball rushing on to him perhaps - and toe-ends it back towards the bowler
length, on off stump. Bell lays bat on ball and gets a single for his troubles. Is there anyone in the covers?
Harbhajan stays round the wicket, he's just a little too full on Bell's toes though and is driven down the ground
Strauss aims an aggressive stroke to leg, it doesn't quite come off but he still gets one
whipped off the pads, excellent milking of the offspinner
Strauss stands at the crease and drives straight to the cover fielder
Strauss bends into a sweep, hitting the ball hard but straight out to the fielder in the deep
this is all too easy for England, gaps everywhere and Bell picks up another single to square leg. Still, the good news for India is that there've been no boundaries in the last two overs
seaming away from the bat, played down to third man
fuller, muscled out through the leg side and they're back for the second
cut, and cut well, but out to the fielder

again Munaf has Bell playing much too early! If that's a slower ball it's very canny indeed, if it's the wicket why are none of the other bowlers getting it to do this? The bottom hand comes off again, the ball loops temptingly over point but England's luck continues
driven hard but straight to Raina at extra cover ... the misfield allows a run. Sloppy
nudged into the gap at short third man, and they're off for a single before point can get round
turn for Chawla! He lands the legspinner on a great length, the ball rips back in but Strauss is seeing it really well now and steps back to pick up one to cover
turn once again - it's the legspinner - but it starts too wide, and the width allows a cut and a single to cover point
the googly? It seemed to rush on more than anything, but it was just a little too short, Strauss sits on the back foot and taps to leg
paddle sweep, down to fine leg
short again, a real long-hop and Strauss puts it away in emphatic fashion! Pulled in the air to wide long-on, easy peasy
Strauss hangs back once again, this time playing the ball very late off the pad and behind square on the leg side for a single
full from round the wicket, Strauss drives it back down the track
Strauss nails a sweep out to square leg, good fielding from a diving Yusuf Pathan saves the boundary
too short, cracked out through the covers and that equals Strauss's best score in ODIs
Harbhajan stays round the wicket to Bell, who lunges forward and drives down the ground
arm ball from Harbhajan, not sure Strauss picked that but he jabs the bat down in time to keep it out
punched out to deep cover where the fielder, Gambhir it is, is a little slow off the mark and so they're back for two
dropped by Kohli at slip! Bell sliced hard at the ball and the ball flew fast, but that was a regulation chance. It goes begging, and India are really deflated now
Bell stretches well forward and drives to cover now ... looks like there might be some cramp setting in there

an ungainly sweep ends in Bell collapsed on a heap next to the wicket ... he's not laid bat on ball but that cramp has really struck now. He's down and in some pain. Out rushes the physio. Definitely cramp I'd say, not an injury
legspinner, cracked back to the bowler
again he drives, this time it beats a diving Chawla and rolls down to third man
slider from Chawla, Strauss rocks back and forces out to deep cover
good start from Zaheer, up and around off stump. Strauss drives to cover, the crowd have woken up a bit now, they know this is India's last chance
Strauss saunters down the wicket, clears his front leg and absolutely nails this... but to the one man out on the midwicket boundary
plenty of noise from the crowd now, pleading for something. Zaheer goes  full and Bell drives hard back at him. Zaheer glares at him

Powerplays always cause trouble and Bell has gifted his wicket away! Struggling with cramp perhaps, he's tried to clear the field with a real heave, skews it off the edge and it loops to mid-off. Wild celebrations, this is far from over

this match is alive! Zaheer has flipped it on its head again. What a delivery! Searing yorker, swinging in late and it's crashed into Strauss's boot in front of middle. Ends an innings of the highest highest quality but will it be in vain?
Zaheer on a hat-trick, Prior manages to resist by nervously pushing to cover. The whole feeling has changed now!
plenty of turn all of a sudden, zipping away sharply from Collingwood who pokes a defence. Looked nervy, who could blame him
there is that googly, Collingwood didn't pick it. Ended up jabbing hurriedly as he saw it coming in
ooh, the pitch suddenly seems a minefield, it's not but pressure does that. Collingwood bunts with his favourite inside edge to mid-on and scampers through
ooh, Chawla's googlies to new batsmen are venom. Prior was hanging back and almost got done there...
another wrong 'un, line was wrong as well though and it slipped down the leg side
short ball sat up asking for trouble, Prior screamed it but straight to cover. The crowd cheering every dot, it's a cauldron again out there

suddenly the fielding has picked up too! Oh cricket. Prior laces a drive towards cover who dives smartly to pick up cleanly. Just 56 runs? That will feel ten times that for Collingwood and Prior at the moment. Just 5 runs from the last 3 overs...
slower ball here, Collingwood tried to break the shackles with a big heave to leg, through the shot too quickly though and it bobbles off the arm. Prior swiftly called him through for a single
this is a good shot for a single, Prior clearing his front leg and crunching this back down the ground, but long-on is out there and the Indian fielders are sprightly again

Zaheer is the man! Collingwood down the track to try and swing to leg but Zaheer slipped it in slower, such smart bowling, gripped off the pitch as well and pegged back off stump. Incredible spell this. India are favourites again! Is there are influential player than Zaheer? Take him out the India attack and it's threadbare. Good luck Michael Yardy...
he's a calm fellow Yardy but keeping in control now must be impossible, he does well here though, steering through cover point for a single
required rate climbing, Prior nudges this to the leg side and hares off. Even singles seem impossible all of a sudden
plenty of chat from Zaheer! Probably talking through his three wickets. Another perfect yorker that Yardy can only dig out to cover
tossed up by Harbhajan, good stuff from him, Prior scythes a drive without timing it all that well out to deep cover

The crowd erupts! Harbhajan has Prior now, the light fading for England. Prior tried to mow this out of the ground over midwicket, Harbhajan always gets that extra bounce though and it found an edge and soared high in the air for midwicket to pouch
this is very far outside off stump, Yardy starts so wide of leg that he has to really reach to toe end this towards third man
boundary, precious, precious runs. Touch of room outside off stump for Yardy and he slices a cut shot, sliding it past the short third man
fired in flatter and fuller and Yardy jabs it away to cover
Bresnan edges down the wicket but keeps his head, pushing a single to cover
Bresnan clears his front leg and tries to pierce the offside ring, swings hard but without much timing and can only find a single to mid-off
Yardy needed more from that, really misdirected, fired down the leg side, but Yardy couldn't get much bat on it and it dribbled out to Harbhajan at fine leg
Bresnan still believes, he's had such a good game. Sees a slower ball and slugs it around the corner, scampering hard for a second
another slower ball but Bresnan doesn't pick this. Swings again, but too early on the shot and it bobbles off the arm
Yardy playing this nicely, slicing out to deep point. Hares back for a second but England need boundaries soon

ooh, top fielding at point saves four here. Yardy squeezed out a fullish ball and timed it well but diving fielding prevented damage. What a Powerplay for India, just 25 runs and four, four wickets. Zaheer's work is done.
Yardy looking for something expansive but only finds a thickish edge that runs away to third man. Somehow a boundary has got to come
Munaf is full and straight, you know what you'll get and Dhoni has set the field for it. Try as he did, Bresnan heaving through the line can only earn a single down the ground

Yardy is out, and England must be as well now. Strauss has his head in his hand, he deserved more. Yardy tried to flip this over short fine leg but couldn't get enough on the slower ball and it spooned straight to the man
more canny work from Munaf, full and straight, Swann times his drive nicely but all along the ground to the long-off fielder
Bresnan heaving but just can't get the timing or elevation to drag England back into this
lovely slower ball from Munaf. Saw Swann advancing, slipped it in slower, Swann ended up pushing back to him and there could well have been a run out but Munaf opted not to shy at the stumps
big slog sweep attempted, but Swann only finds fresh air
absolute silence as Swann is on the sweep again. This time getting all of it and it shoots flat, hard over the midwicket rope!
Swann down the wicket now to try and swing a similar shot, this one skews off the leading edge and looped towards third man on the bounce
ooh, Bresnan trying to match Swann but can't quite time it as well. Pressure on though and a misfield allows him to come back for a second
Bresnan has nailed this! Not another twist, surely! Down one knee, clearing his front leg and thrashing the life out of it, to send it rocketing over midwicket once more
Chawla strikes back! One way and another this match is going! Bresnan tried again to to find the boundary, he had to, but it's quicker and flatter and through him onto off stump
Swann gives himself room outside off to drive towards cover, doesn't get the boundary he needs but a misfield allows him to keep the strike by scampering back a second
wonderful stuff from Munaf, perfect slower ball, nothing for Swann to work with and he can only outside edge to third man. Shahzad hits a long ball though...

Strauss is on his feet, Swann is screaming! What a shot from Shahzad! So clean! Just got his front leg out the way, got the half-volley he wanted and creamed it straight down the ground, over the bowler's head and into the stands for six!

Shahzad misses outside off but Swann has called through for a bye! Clever, steely stuff from Munaf, quite how a bowler holds his nerve in a situation like this is beyond me.  Oh Shahzad what a strike that was.

Swann miles down the track, wants the boundary to finish it but finds an inside edge by heaving to leg. Manic running and slow fielding have him back for a second. One to tie, but two for a famous, unbelievable win...

It's a tie! 100 overs of scintillating ODI cricket and the scores are level! That's what World Cup cricket is about! Swann drives hard as Munaf finds a perfect line and length, hit it cleanly but straight to mid-off who managed to make no fumble and pinned England to a single to seal the tie
